symptoms.name: Abdominal pain
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be absent or present in the liver region

vital_signs.blood pressure: Can be within normal range (121/69 mmHg)

physical_findings: Abdominal tenderness, particularly in the liver region
risk_factors: Travel to tropical areas with poor sanitation
Consumption of contaminated food or water
Male gender (significantly higher prevalence in males)

imaging_findings.Ultrasound: Mixed mass with low enhancement in the peripheral ring and non-enhancement in the inner area, suggestive of liquefied abscess
imaging_findings.Contrast-enhanced ultrasound: Mixed mass (size varies), with low enhancement in the peripheral ring after SonoVue contrast agent injection, and non-enhancement in the inner area

required: Clinical presentation consistent with amebic liver abscess (fever, abdominal pain, etc.)
Imaging findings suggestive of liver abscess (CT, ultrasound)
Positive PCR for Entamoeba histolytica DNA in abscess fluid or stool
supportive: Presence of Charcot-Leiden crystals in abscess fluid
Positive serology for Entamoeba histolytica (though less reliable in endemic areas)
